intro: Spirolobium cambodianum, commonly known as the Cambodian spiroball, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Cambodia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, spiral-shaped flowers that bloom in bright yellow or orange hues. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
